channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: Challenging Elites, Defending Democracy: Oxfam’s Amitabh Behar Speaks Out
item.description: Speaking to IPS on the sidelines of the International Civil Society Week in Bangkok (November 1–5), Amitabh Behar, Executive Director of Oxfam International and a passionate human rights advocate, highlighted his concerns about rising inequality, growing authoritarianism, and the misuse of AI and surveillance. Yet, he expressed optimism that, even as civic spaces shrink, young […]

item.title: Flags raised in Doha as leaders gather for UN social development summit
item.description: Against a quiet morning sky, the flags of the United Nations and the State of Qatar rose together in Doha on Sunday, ahead of the Second World Summit for Social Development.

item.title: Strengthening Indigenous Lands Rights Key in Solving Deforestation in Amazon
item.description: Research shows that lands managed by Indigenous Peoples have lower deforestation rates and store significantly more carbon than other areas.

item.title: This week in global development
item.description: This Week in Global Development is Devex’s podcast series covering the top stories from the global development sector.

item.title: Results of PassBlue’s Survey: ‘Vote for the Next UN Secretary-General’
item.description: The results are in from our recent informal readers’ survey on who should be the next UN secretary-general for the five-year term starting in 2027. The voting is as follows: Michelle Bachelet of Chile finished with a commanding victory, taking more than 29 percent of the vote. That percentage is more than double the votes ... Read more

item.title: Defending Democracy in a “Topsy-Turvy” World
item.description: It is a bleak global moment—with civil society actors battling assassinations, imprisonment, fabricated charges, and funding cuts to pro-democracy movements in a world gripped by inequality, climate chaos, and rising authoritarianism. Yet, the mood at Bangkok’s Thammasat University was anything but defeated. Once the site of the 1976 massacre, where pro-democracy students were brutally crushed, […]

item.title: ‘We want to get our lives back,’ Gaza children declare
item.description: After two years of war that kept them out of classrooms, Gaza’s children are finally returning to the classroom, surrounded by devastation – but determined to learn.

item.title: Defending truth-tellers, from war zones to the digital frontline
item.description: Journalists risk their lives every day to bring facts to light, yet most attacks against them go unpunished.

item.title: Workers face worsening inequality without urgent reforms, UN agency warns
item.description: The world of work is undergoing rapid and destabilising change, with widening inequality and job insecurity leaving millions without stable livelihoods or basic protections.
